cause.description:
Many people think public lands just include our National Parks. However, in all there are over 600 million acres of public lands in the U.S., which include Bureau of Land Management (BLM) land, National Wildlife Refuges and National Fish Hatcheries managed by the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, National Forests and National Grasslands managed by the U.S. Forest Service, and other lands managed by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, the Bureau of Reclamation and the Army Corps of Engineers.
Created by National Wildlife Action™ visit www.ourpubliclands.org --this website provides information on public lands issues of both national and state significance. Although issues across all public lands are featured, this site focuses on the western states of Montana, Wyoming, Colorado and New Mexico where the public lands conservation tradition runs deep.
Learn more about threats to America’s public lands and speak up to protect them. Track how your elected officials are voting on public lands legislation and hold them accountable. Link directly to buy your hunting license. Showcase your favorite outdoor experience by posting your story and pictures. Find out about public lands events in your area.
1. protect our public lands
